item.title: Physics Olympiad Notes
item.description: A little bit about me: I participated in the F=ma competition all four years of high school, and ended up making the US Physics Camp in junior and senior year of high school. In junior year, I was also part of the International Physics Olympiad team, where I won a gold medal as a part of the first and only all-gold US IPhO Team. Notes My notes on physics olympiads are located here.

item.title: Astronomy Olympiad Notes
item.description: Introduction During my time in high school, I participated in the United States Astronomy and Astrophysics Olympiad (USAAAO) for three years, as well as the International Olympiad in Astronomy and Astrophysics for the last two of those years, winning gold medals in both years. In my senior year of high school, I also helped contribute problems to the USAAAO. Study Notes During my studying, I created four study notes documents:

item.title: About
item.description: I’m William Huang, an undergraduate at Stanford studying Computer Science and Physics. For a summary of my professional education and experience, my resume is located here. If you’d like to contact me, please email willsh@stanford.edu. I’m passionate about all things computer science and physics. To be more specific, on the computer science side, I’m interested in the multitude of applications of artificial intelligence and machine learning to develop better solutions to problems on the personal, communal, industrial, and global scales.

item.title: Scavenger Hunt Results
item.description: Congrats to everyone who participated! Below are the results: Overall Results 1. Team Navy (a full 9 minutes before everyone else!) 2. Team Turquoise 3. (counselor) Titus 4. Emmy 5. (counselor) Mahathi 6. Aashray 7. Akshar 8. Team Azure Top Teams 1. Team Navy 2. Team Turquoise 3. Team Azure Top Individuals 1. Emmy 2. Aashray 3. Akshar

item.title: Congratulations
item.description: Congratulations! You’ve finished the scavenger hunt. During the event’s duration, this page would’ve had a form for you to show off to everyone that you’re a winner. For the event’s results, click here.

item.title: Final Clue
item.description: Answer Format Express your answer as: “ourthemesongis” + (your answer).

item.title: Ninth Clue
item.description: Clue On the USESO Camp Discord, the counselors have access to a secret chat where we discuss top secret things. What is the name of that secret chat? Answer Express your answer as (your answer) + “rule”.

item.title: Eighth Clue
item.description: Clue What word did Mahathi say during Yuchen’s optional talk? Answer Format Express your answer in the form “shesaid” + (your answer).

item.title: Seventh Clue
item.description: Clue “California has bad _____” - Jaime 2022 Answer Format Express your answer in the following form: “smoke” + (your answer).

item.title: Sixth Clue
item.description: Clue The USESO counselors are often hard at work coordinating many of the events occuring throughout the week. Sometimes, to blow off a little steam, we host counselor-only events, such as high-stakes poker and high-octane garticphone. In one of these high-octane garticphone events, James was shown with a prompt with one of our names that James couldn’t draw, so instead he chose a color to represent the name. What color did James choose?

item.title: Fifth Clue
item.description: Clue I exist in everything from sports to school And I rhyme with something that floats. You make me if you don’t want to sound like a fool But you don’t show me off to gloat. Your counselors have been hard at work Revising me and my look. Before I’m ready I have many quirks But once I’m finished you’ll be shook. Answer Format Format your answer as (your answer to the clue above) + “picks”.

item.title: Fourth Clue
item.description: Clue There are four boxes labelled “Rocks”, “Minerals”, “Rocks and Minerals”, and “Special Minerals”. None of the boxes are labelled correctly. If you find a rock in both the “Rocks and Minerals” box and the “Rocks” box, what are the correct labels for every box? Answer Format Abbreviating the boxes as r, m, rnm, and sm, format your answer as the correct labels for the boxes in the above order.

item.title: Third Clue
item.description: Clue Two words. Answer Format Your answer should come in the form of two words and no spaces between them.

item.title: Second Clue
item.description: Clue Roses are red, Violets are blue, Scott thinks turquoise is of this hue. Answer Format Provide your answer in the following format: “thewrongansweris” + (the answer to the clue).

item.title: First Clue
item.description: Clue We’ve come to the end of camp and the memories are already fading Let’s thank all the counselors who spent these last few nights _______ Answer Format The answer will be of the form “2022” + (the answer to the above clue).

item.title: USESO Scavenger Hunt
item.description: How the Hunt Works The hunt works in the following manner. This first page is going to give you a clue, which will lead you to the next url. To guess the next page, go to will-s-h.github.io/sh/(the answer you think it is). Make sure to include the /sh, which stands for scavenger hunt! If you are correct, the website should show the next clue; if not, you will get a 404 error.
